toggle.heading: Here are the best liberal arts colleges in the U.S.

hero.title: National Liberal Arts Colleges
hero.description: The National Liberal Arts Colleges, including schools like Colby College and Wesleyan University, emphasize undergraduate education and award at least half of their degrees in the liberal arts fields of study.
hero.subtitle: Here are the best liberal arts colleges in the U.S.

institution.footnote: This school declined to fill out the U.S. News & World Report main statistical survey. Data that appears is from either what the school reported in previous years or from another source, such as the National Center for Education Statistics.

acceptanceRate.noteText: Data reported to U.S. News in previous years

items.blurb: Founded in 1965, Hampshire College is a private institution.

institution.footnote: This school declined to fill out the U.S. News & World Report main statistical survey. Data that appears is from either what the school reported in previous years or from another source, such as the National Center for Education Statistics.

items.blurb: Founded in 1867, Johnson C. Smith University is a private institution. The student-faculty ratio at Johnson C. Smith University is 12:1.

actAvg.noteText: SAT and/or ACT may not be required by school for some or all applicants, and in reporting SAT/ACT scores, the school did not include all students for whom it had scores, or refused to tell U.S. News whether all students with scores had been included.

items.blurb: Founded in 1838, Judson College is a private institution.
Founded in 1938, The King's College is a private institution. The King's College follows a semester-based academic calendar and its admissions are considered selective.

actAvg.noteText: SAT and/or ACT not required by school for some or all applicants.

items.blurb: Founded in 1882, Lane College is a private institution. The school has 42.7% of its classes with fewer than 20 students, and the student-faculty ratio at Lane College is 20:1.

items.blurb: Founded in 1960, Louisiana State University--Alexandria is a public institution.

satAvg.noteText: SAT and/or ACT not required by school for some or all applicants.

items.blurb: Founded in 1857, Mansfield University of Pennsylvania is a public institution. Mansfield University of Pennsylvania follows a semester-based academic calendar and its admissions are considered less selective.

satAvg.noteText: SAT and/or ACT not required by school for some or all applicants.

items.blurb: Founded in 1933, Marymount California University is a private institution. The school has 53.8% of its classes with fewer than 20 students, and the student-faculty ratio at Marymount California University is 17:1.

Marymount Manhattan College, a private school on the Upper East Side of New York City, offers 25 major programs of study. Students at Marymount Manhattan can walk a few blocks to Central Park, take a subway ride to a Broadway show or join one of the nearly 40 organizations on campus.

satAvg.noteText: Previous year's data was used in the ranking calculation.

items.blurb: Founded in 1911, Pine Manor College is a private institution. Pine Manor College follows a semester-based academic calendar and its admissions are considered least selective.

utag_data.stitial_fact: Upward of 304,000 Chinese students studied in the U.S. during the 2014-2015 academic year.
